thread.title: Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp says players ignored his instructions for Leicester City game | Metro News
thread.title_full: Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp says players ignored his instructions for Leicester City game | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp says players ignored his instructions for Leicester City game | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 10:56 pm Jurgen Klopp was unhappy with his players after the game (Picture: Getty) 
Jurgen Klopp has admitted he is not sure whether his Liverpool players were listening when he outline their tactics for the Leicester City game. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
Liverpool fell foul of trademark Leicester plays as Jamie Vardy hugged the offside line and continually found himself in a foot race with Lucas Leiva. 
Klopp’s tactics were slammed by Jamie Carragher at half-time , but the Liverpool boss hinted his players did not play as he told them to. 
‘If you play well and lose matches then that’s just football,’ said Klopp after the game. Liverpool fixtures 
Arsenal (H) – Sat 4 Mar Burnley (H) – Sun 12 Mar Man City (A) – Sun 19 Mar Everton (H) – Sat 1 Apr Bournemouth (H) – Wed 5 Apr Stoke City (A) – Sat 8 Apr Jamie Vardy ran rings around Liverpool’s defenders (Picture: Getty) 
‘But it looks like we never spoke about the strength of Leicester and that’s the trouble. 
‘I have already spoken in the dressing room to the players, that performance was not enough for sure. 
‘We have to try with everything we have to do better.’ Liverpool had over two weeks to prepare for the Leicester City game (Picture: Getty) 
Liverpool’s terrible start to 2017 continues with the Reds collecting just one league win since the start of the year. 
Klopp’s side are currently plummeting down the Premier League table, but the German cannot understand why the same problems keeping cropping up in games. 
‘If you are not good enough you lose football games,’ he said. 
‘I have no reason for this at the moment. Leicester ran out easy 3-1 winners (Picture: Getty)
